isis.stitle: New Vehicle Loss and Damage Procedures Manual - Filing a Loss and Damage Claim

svcproc.title: Filing a Loss and Damage Claim

svcprocinfo.para: Use International System 21 DDEW to submit your claim to International Warranty Claim Center as follows:

item.para: Be certain any damages or shortages described on the claim is identical to that on the carrier's delivery receipt and/or concealed damage notification.
Complete the claim entry portion of the claim identifying claimant, carrier, vehicle identification number, and damage.
Use the CTS-1025, Warranty Coding Manual, for correct group/noun coding in conjunction with failure.
The correct warranty code for loss and damage claims is code "38".
The correct type part, "T/P" for coding can be identified by using the Warranty Coding Manual, CTS-1025.
All damages should be submitted on one DDEW claim utilizing all eight claim sections, one section for each individual repair.

svcsubproc.title: Supporting Documents
svcsubproc.para: The carrier or International may request any or all of the following documents prior to processing the claim:

step1.para: A copy of the delivery receipt showing all exceptions being claimed.
A copy of the work order, accurately reflecting the repair charges, and covering only the noted exceptions.
A copy of the invoice, listing replacement parts by name, quantity, and price.
Photographs and/or estimates of the damage.
When applicable, a copy of the concealed damage and/or after-hours inspection report.
When applicable, a copy of the carrier's inspection report, indicating when the carrier representative was called and when the inspection was made.
When applicable, a copy of the invoice for sublet materials.

note.para: Copies of the above should be retained in the dealer's claim file.

svcsubproc.title: Pre-Authorization
svcsubproc.para: Dealers are required to obtain a prior approval number for loss and damage claims totaling over $1000.00 U.S, and $1600.00 Canadian. Pictures or an estimate for repairs will be requested at this time. An authorization number may be obtained by calling International at 630-753-5242. Obtaining a pre-authorization number for a repair does not insure payment of the claim. Please refer to International Service & Warranty Handbook, CTS-1143.
